title.narrative: OUTPUT 3:MATERNAL &NEWBORN CHILD HEALTH

description.narrative: Knowledge developed and disseminated on Maternal and Newborn Child Health for learning exchanges and partnerships on neonatal mortality reduction in South Asia, which contributes to Child Health, Cross-Sectoral Early Childhood Development, Health And Emergencies, Health Systems Strengthening, Health â€“ General, Hiv â€“ General, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2017, National public health system delivers equitable and quality services on new born survival modelling good practices, contributing to knowledge generation and wider learning

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Knowledge developed and disseminated on Maternal and Newborn Child Health for learning exchanges and partnerships on neonatalmortality reduction in South Asia

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to generate and disseminate knowledge on maternal and newborn child health through facilitation of participation of key government experts in south-south learning exchanges; implementation of an electronic Health Management Information System across the country; and conduct of a study that helped identify strategies to reduce neonatal mortality. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: of knowledge partnerships established with professional/ technical institutions contributing to documentations of good practices
of knowledge products on MCH and new born care developed for wider learning exchange
of joint events organised to support south-south cooperation
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Health Management Information System generates periodic reports with data disaggregated by age and sex (for relevant indicators) at national and sub-national level

baseline.value: The HMIS is functioning and generates routine periodic reports

target.value: 2017:HMIS generates real-time data on newborn care in all 25 districts

actual.value: 2017:e- HMIS functioning in all 25 districts with maternal and child health data, including on new-borns
